{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3341328,"name":"Matt Carr","username":"Matt_Carr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/matt_carr/{size}/211216_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-23T15:16:17.635Z","cooked":"

Our programming team is working on implementing Pathplanner’s AutoBuilder for our autos, with a limelight based wpilib pose estimator. From what we can tell, Pathplanner is using the pose estimator to update itself at the very start of the auto run, but not after it begins. We ran a test where we put the bot up on blocks so it couldn’t move, and ran an auto. The Pathplanner telemetry shows that it thinks it’s moving, even though the pose estimator knows it is not. Does this make sense with the way Pathplanner is intended to work? Is there a way for us to force it to continuously use the robot pose to close the feedback loop? Link to our GitHub repo is below.

GitHub

GitHub - RustBeltRobotics/2024Crescendo: FRC 424 Rust Belt Robotics robot for...

FRC 424 Rust Belt Robotics robot for for the 2024 game, CRESCENDO - RustBeltRobotics/2024Crescendo

Your code in Drivetrain.java looks fine to me. I looked into the source code of PathPlanner awhile back but I don’t remmeber what it uses throughout the path. Its possibke it uses the chassis speeds.

Matt_Carr:

The Pathplanner telemetry shows that it thinks it’s moving, even though the pose estimator knows it is not.

That would be unusual if the pose estimator was getting odometry updates but it wasn’t updating the pose. You would have to have your standard deviations really skewed to trusting vision, which I would not recommend during auto.

You should try putting the estimated pose on your dashboard and watch that in addition to PathPlanner. I’m willing to bet PathPlanner’s telemetry is showing exactly the same current pose as your pose estimator.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T14:58:20.683Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":15.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459805,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-feedback-loop-appears-to-not-be-using-the-robot-s-pose","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-feedback-loop-appears-to-not-be-using-the-robot-s-pose/459805/3","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351256,"name":"Isaac","username":"isaacngkh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T12:17:44.930Z","cooked":"

We are currently testing this as well. From what we have observed, pathplanner during auto definitely does not use pose estimator and adjust path dynamically.

We were going to test adjusting the ReplanningConfig() in configureHolonomic() next.

By default, new ReplanningConfig() enables Initial Replanning but not Dynamic Replanning (you can double check the source code on github). We were going to try turn on Dynamic Replanning as well and change the Total Error Threshold (default is 1) to something like 0.25 and see how it goes.

Let us know how it goes if you are going to try this as well.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T12:17:44.930Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":32,"readers_count":31,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459805,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-feedback-loop-appears-to-not-be-using-the-robot-s-pose","display_username":"Isaac","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pathplanner.dev/api/java/com/pathplanner/lib/util/ReplanningConfig.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"ReplanningConfig (pathplannerlib API)","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63578,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-feedback-loop-appears-to-not-be-using-the-robot-s-pose/459805/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351388,"name":"Matt Carr","username":"Matt_Carr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/matt_carr/{size}/211216_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T14:36:28.096Z","cooked":"

So it turns out our pose estimator was actually weighting odometery significantly higher than vision, to such an extreme that it was almost effectively almost ignoring vision entirely. We noticed that if we allowed path planner to sit not moving for a long time after the completion of the path, the position eventually caught up to the vision measurement. We adjusted our weightings to more reasonable values, and it’s performing much better now.
